outputs.output_descr: Directly drive innovative approaches in volunteer management practices along the volunteer management cycle (and across all modalities); and coordinating inputs for the development of tools and guidance for all stages in the volunteer management cycle

1.	Mobilize UN Online Volunteers  Increasing number and diversity (especially gender, age and origin) of UN Online Volunteers mobilized, through responsive and innovative UN Online Volunteer solutions 
2.	Promote online volunteering  Increasing awareness about online volunteering and capacities of countries to foster online volunteer engagement 
3.	Integrate online volunteering into peace and development programming - Technical advice on designing peace and development programmes/projects to most effectively utilize UN Online volunteer contributions

1. Volunteer management and volunteer modalities - Establishing a standardized approach to tools for managing volunteer engagements 
2. Volunteer Policy Frameworks - Technical assistance to review and co-develop policies guiding volunteerism and volunteer management in national legislation, youth policies and civil society frameworks
3. National Volunteer Programmes - Establishing nationally-owned and managed volunteering programmes to contribute to national development agenda
4. Integrating volunteerism for peace and development - Technical advice on capitalizing on the contribution volunteers in peace and development initiatives; and Technical advice on designing peace and development programmes/projects to most effectively utilize volunteer modalities/initiatives
Strategy, tools, and processes are in place to support knowledge collection and sharing within and outside UNV.

The volunteer learning strategy aims supporting UN Volunteers personal and professional grow in order to enhance programme value and the effectiveness of the host organization and bring forward the value of volunteerism into their assignments and beyond.

project_descr: The project was designed to drive innovative approaches to promote, integrate and support volunteerism as a means for contributing to peace and development results through programming, policy and capacity development
